page_analysis.text_content:
Fig 8 Entry feature with 2nd floor above

Note: The 2nd floor over a vaulted entry
will count as usual. Therefore, the area will
count three times toward gross floor area.

Note: If the entryway is considered to be a vaulted entryway
the area will be counted as follows:
* In this example, a portion of the entryway is recessed
beyond the house facade and roof. It is included in the
area that counts.
* The area is measured to the outside material of the entry-
way feature.
* The area counts TWICE toward gross floor area.

Intersection of front
facade and under-
side or bottom of
2nd floor

Top of 2nd floor
Bottom of 2nd floor

Height

Height
Grade

floor area that counts

vaulted

13

visual_elements.description: An isometric view of a building's entry feature with a second floor above. It shows a vaulted entry with columns and windows on the second floor. A dashed line indicates the 'Grade' level, and an arrow labeled 'Height' measures from the grade to the underside of the second floor. Another dashed line extends vertically from the front facade.

A side elevation view of the same building entry feature. It shows the vertical extent of the entry and the second floor. Dashed lines indicate the 'Top of 2nd floor' and 'Bottom of 2nd floor'. An arrow labeled 'Height' measures from the ground level to the bottom of the second floor. A callout points to the 'Intersection of front facade and underside or bottom of 2nd floor'.

A porch floor plan view, showing the outline of the entryway. A thicker black line indicates the 'Outline of entryway floor area that counts TWICE if entryway is vaulted'. The plan shows the recessed nature of the entryway relative to the main building outline.

technical_specifications.parameter: 2nd floor over vaulted entry area count

subheadings: Fig 8 Entry feature with 2nd floor above
Note: The 2nd floor over a vaulted entry will count as usual. Therefore, the area will count three times toward gross floor area.
Note: If the entryway is considered to be a vaulted entryway the area will be counted as follows:

additional_notes: Page number '13' is present at the bottom right corner.

qualifiers.text: The 2nd floor over a vaulted entry
If the entryway is considered to be a vaulted entryway
In this example, a portion of the entryway is recessed beyond the house facade and roof.

conditions.text: the area will count three times toward gross floor area.
It is included in the area that counts.
The area is measured to the outside material of the entry-way feature.
The area counts TWICE toward gross floor area.

logical_relationships.expression: IF (The 2nd floor over a vaulted entry) THEN (the area will count three times toward gross floor area.)
IF (If the entryway is considered to be a vaulted entryway) THEN (the area will be counted as follows: [c2, c3, c4])
In this example, a portion of the entryway is recessed beyond the house facade and roof. It is included in the area that counts.
Outline of entryway floor area that counts TWICE if entryway is vaulted

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate if there is a 2nd floor over a vaulted entry.
If step 1 is true, apply the rule for 2nd floor area counting.
Evaluate if the entryway is considered a vaulted entryway.
If step 3 is true, then apply the rules for entryway area counting.
Specifically, if the entryway is recessed beyond the house facade and roof, include it in the area that counts.
Measure the entryway area to the outside material of the feature.
Count the entryway area TWICE toward gross floor area.
